ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: improved Spanish speaking and reading abilities, more complex grammatical structures compared to Spanish L3
Expanded on grammar and read my first novel in Spanish. Gained proficiency in speaking more fluently.
Greatly improved my confidence, conversational skills in the language and my comprehension of more advanced text.
More spanish grammar and vocab. You improve on reading skills and speaking skills with the variety of projects and presentations you have.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A lot of the work was busy work that was just unnecessary.
This is a great course, no improvements needed that I can think of right now.
There is too much homework every night and the textbook is not helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's a standard class that people have to take to fulfill requirements usually.
This is a really great course. I feel much more comfortable speaking and communicating in Spanish after taking L4, and David Ortega is so kind.
Absolutely! Especially with David. This was an amazing, comfortable experience and was mostly just about actually practicing what was learned in L3
I would recommend this if it is to fullfil a language requirement or if you are very interested in spanish but besides that it is a lot of work every night.
